review: I've got this for my girlfriend who had no way to connect Netflix to her TV other than to plug her computer in via HDMI every time.  This allows her to turn on her TV and stream Netflix using her iPad/iPhone as a remote.  We've experienced some hiccups but the dongle is actually pretty darn far from the router so I must say the range is pretty good for a $35 device.As for using this to stream your computer screen to your TV it only lets you stream your chrome browser and there is some SEVERE lag.  But for the price and capability of streaming Netflix with ease I can't complain.  5 stars it is.

review: The only complaint I have is the lack of apps that support the chromecast. As more apps come to support the chromecast its usefulness will increase. review: I bought this yesterday and I love it. The setup is simple as plugging it in and following the directions on the screen. I can't get enough of it. It definitely beats having to watch hulu plus on my chromebook by a long shot. When I was streaming from my chromebook, I noticed that it was lagging. But, once I streamed it from my phone it was perfect. I don't miss watching regular tv anymore because it seems like nothing is ever on. Not only can I watch whatever I want on my tv whenever I want, I can also listen to music from google play. Im sure many people are wondering if their tv can support chromecast, well most, if not all tvs can support it. All you need is an HDMI port, the usb port is optional because the chromecast comes with a usb cord and a wall charger that can attach to one another so that you can plug it into the wall but, an HDMI port is a must. So, go buy one, it's totally worth it.
